fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: This includes any of the following: (a) accepting bribes, (b) helping to obtain government contracts for firms that the legislator (or his/her family/friends/political supporters) own, (c) doing favors for firms in exchange for the opportunity of employment after leaving the legislature, (d) stealing money from the state or from campaign donations for personal use. Please make your best estimate, based upon what is known or suspected to be true.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_notes: For reasons of consistency, as of December, 2014, responses to this question are reversed so that the least democratic response is ”0” and the most democratic is ”4”.
fxInfo_question: Do members of the legislature abuse their position for financial gain?

fxInfo_responses.value: Commonly. Most legislators probably engage in these activities.
Often. Many legislators probably engage in these activities.
Sometimes. Some legislators probably engage in these activities.
Very occasionally. There may be a few legislators who engage in these activities but the vast majority do not.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2lgcrrpt,*_osp, *_ord
